      Checks whether a piece can be added at (x, y), i.e. if (x, y) are within the board dimensions (xDim, yDim) and if the tower height is less than zDim.

      Creates and returns a deep copy of the board.

      Creates and returns a deep copy of the boardData, to use for the view.
      private boolean directionHasWon(int x, int y, int z, int xDir, int yDir, int zDir)
      Checks whether the direction (xDir, yDir, zDir), including its reverse, starting at the cell (x, y, z) is winning.
      java.util.List<Coordinates> getAvailableTowers()
      Returns a List of Coordinates of each tower where a piece can be added, i.e. towers with valid coordinates that are not full.
      java.lang.Integer getCellOwner(int x, int y, int z)
      Returns the owner of the cell (x, y, z), null if no owner.

      Gets the tower at (x, y).

      Returns the Coordinates belonging to a tower index.

      Returns the height of the tower at (x, y).
      boolean hasWon(int x, int y)
      Checks whether the last added piece at (x, y) belongs to a winning set, i.e. it belongs to a connected set of winningLength pieces belonging to its owner.
      boolean isEmptyCell(int x, int y, int z)
      Checks whether the given cell is empty, i.e.
      boolean isFull()
      Checks whether the board is full.
      boolean isValidCell(int x, int y, int z)
      Checks whether (x, y, z) is a valid cell on the board, i.e. whether the cell coordinates are within the dimensions.
      boolean isValidTower(int x, int y)
      Checks whether (x, y) is a valid tower on the board, i.e. whether the tower coordinates are within the dimensions.

      Add a piece to the tower at (x, y).

      Resets the board to an empty board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int xDim,
             int yDim,
             int zDim,
             int winningLength)
        Create a new board with specified dimensions and winning length.
        Parameters:
        xDim - X dimension of the board
        yDim - Y dimension of the board
        zDim - Z dimension of the board, -1 specifies unlimited
        winningLength - Connected pieces required to win the game

      • Board

        public Board()
        Create a board with default settings and rules.

    • Method Detail

      • checkMove

        public boolean checkMove(int x,
                         int y)
        Checks whether a piece can be added at (x, y), i.e. if (x, y) are within the board dimensions (xDim, yDim) and if the tower height is less than zDim.
        Parameters:
        x - X position
        y - Y position
        Returns:
        Tower at (x, y) exists and isn't full

      • hasWon

        public boolean hasWon(int x,
                      int y)
               throws CoordinatesOutOfBoundsException
        Checks whether the last added piece at (x, y) belongs to a winning set, i.e. it belongs to a connected set of winningLength pieces belonging to its owner.
        Parameters:
        x - X position
        y - Y position
        Returns:
        Piece at (x, y, getTowerHeight(z)) belongs to winning set
        Throws:
        CoordinatesOutOfBoundsException

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Checks whether the board is full.
        Returns:
        Board is full

      • getAvailableTowers

        public java.util.List<Coordinates> getAvailableTowers()
        Returns a List of Coordinates of each tower where a piece can be added, i.e. towers with valid coordinates that are not full.
        Returns:
        List of Coordinates of available towers

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
        Creates and returns a deep copy of the board.
        Returns:
        Deep copy of this board

        Creates and returns a deep copy of the boardData, to use for the view.
        Returns:
        Copy of the board data.

      • isEmptyCell

        public boolean isEmptyCell(int x,
                           int y,
                           int z)
                    throws CoordinatesOutOfBoundsException
        Checks whether the given cell is empty, i.e. getCellOwner(x, y, z) == null.
        Parameters:
        x - X position to check
        y - Y position to check
        z - Z position to check
        Returns:
        (x, y, z) is empty
        Throws:
        CoordinatesOutOfBoundsException

        private boolean directionHasWon(int x,
                                int y,
                                int z,
                                int xDir,
                                int yDir,
                                int zDir)
        Checks whether the direction (xDir, yDir, zDir), including its reverse, starting at the cell (x, y, z) is winning.
        Parameters:
        x - X position of cell
        y - Y position of cell
        z - Z position of cell
        xDir - X direction
        yDir - Y direction
        zDir - Z direction
        Returns:
        Direction has won

      • isValidTower

        public boolean isValidTower(int x,
                            int y)
        Checks whether (x, y) is a valid tower on the board, i.e. whether the tower coordinates are within the dimensions.
        Parameters:
        x - X position
        y - Y position
        Returns:
        (x, y) are valid tower coordinates

        z - Z position

        y - Y position to place piece at
